trans-unit.source: Protect your API with Azure API Management | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Protect your API with Azure API Management | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to protect your API with quotas and throttling (rate-limiting) policies.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to protect your API with quotas and throttling (rate-limiting) policies.

trans-unit.source: This guide shows you how easy it is to add protection for your backend API by configuring rate limit and quota policies with Azure API Management.
trans-unit.target: This guide shows you how easy it is to add protection for your backend API by configuring rate limit and quota policies with Azure API Management.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will create a "Free Trial" API product that allows developers to make up to 10 calls per minute and up to a maximum of 200 calls per week to your API.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will create a "Free Trial" API product that allows developers to make up to 10 calls per minute and up to a maximum of 200 calls per week to your API.

trans-unit.source: You will then publish the API and test the rate limit policy.
trans-unit.target: You will then publish the API and test the rate limit policy.

trans-unit.source: If you already have a product configured and want to use it for this tutorial, you can jump ahead to <linkText>Configure call rate limit and quota policies</linkText><title></title> and follow the tutorial from there using your product in place of the Free Trial product.
trans-unit.target: If you already have a product configured and want to use it for this tutorial, you can jump ahead to <linkText>Configure call rate limit and quota policies</linkText><title></title> and follow the tutorial from there using your product in place of the Free Trial product.

trans-unit.source: In this step, you will create a Free Trial product that does not require subscription approval.
trans-unit.target: In this step, you will create a Free Trial product that does not require subscription approval.

trans-unit.source: To get started, click Manage in the Azure portal for your API Management service.
trans-unit.target: To get started, click Manage in the Azure portal for your API Management service.

trans-unit.source: This takes you to the API Management publisher portal.
trans-unit.target: This takes you to the API Management publisher portal.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Publisher portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Publisher portal</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you have not yet created an API Management service instance, see <linkText>Create an API Management service instance</linkText><title></title> in the <linkText>Get started with Azure API Management</linkText><title></title> tutorial.
trans-unit.target: If you have not yet created an API Management service instance, see <linkText>Create an API Management service instance</linkText><title></title> in the <linkText>Get started with Azure API Management</linkText><title></title> tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Click Products in the API Management menu on the left to display the Products page.
trans-unit.target: Click Products in the API Management menu on the left to display the Products page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add product</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add product</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add product to display the Add new product dialog box.
trans-unit.target: Click Add product to display the Add new product dialog box.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add new product</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add new product</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Title box, type Free Trial.
trans-unit.target: In the Title box, type Free Trial.

trans-unit.source: In the Description box, type the following text: Subscribers will be able to run 10 calls/minute up to a maximum of 200 calls/week after which access is denied.
trans-unit.target: In the Description box, type the following text: Subscribers will be able to run 10 calls/minute up to a maximum of 200 calls/week after which access is denied.

trans-unit.source: Products in API Management can be protected or open.
trans-unit.target: Products in API Management can be protected or open.

trans-unit.source: Protected products must be subscribed to before they can be used.
trans-unit.target: Protected products must be subscribed to before they can be used.

trans-unit.source: Open products can be used without a subscription.
trans-unit.target: Open products can be used without a subscription.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that Require subscription is selected to create a protected product that requires a subscription.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that Require subscription is selected to create a protected product that requires a subscription.

trans-unit.source: This is the default setting.
trans-unit.target: This is the default setting.

trans-unit.source: If you want an administrator to review and accept or reject subscription attempts to this product, select Require subscription approval.
trans-unit.target: If you want an administrator to review and accept or reject subscription attempts to this product, select Require subscription approval.

trans-unit.source: If the check box is not selected, subscription attempts will be auto-approved.
trans-unit.target: If the check box is not selected, subscription attempts will be auto-approved.

trans-unit.source: In this example, subscriptions are automatically approved, so do not select the box.
trans-unit.target: In this example, subscriptions are automatically approved, so do not select the box.

trans-unit.source: To allow developer accounts to subscribe multiple times to the new product, select the Allow multiple simultaneous subscriptions check box.
trans-unit.target: To allow developer accounts to subscribe multiple times to the new product, select the Allow multiple simultaneous subscriptions check box.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial does not utilize multiple simultaneous subscriptions, so leave it unchecked.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial does not utilize multiple simultaneous subscriptions, so leave it unchecked.

trans-unit.source: After all values are entered, click Save to create the product.
trans-unit.target: After all values are entered, click Save to create the product.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Product added</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Product added</linkText>

trans-unit.source: By default, new products are visible to users in the Administrators group.
trans-unit.target: By default, new products are visible to users in the Administrators group.

trans-unit.source: We are going to add the Developers group.
trans-unit.target: We are going to add the Developers group.

trans-unit.source: Click Free Trial, and then click the Visibility tab.
trans-unit.target: Click Free Trial, and then click the Visibility tab.

trans-unit.source: In API Management, groups are used to manage the visibility of products to developers.
trans-unit.target: In API Management, groups are used to manage the visibility of products to developers.

trans-unit.source: Products grant visibility to groups, and developers can view and subscribe to the products that are visible to the groups in which they belong.
trans-unit.target: Products grant visibility to groups, and developers can view and subscribe to the products that are visible to the groups in which they belong.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>How to create and use groups in Azure API Management</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>How to create and use groups in Azure API Management</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add developers group</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add developers group</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select the Developers check box, and then click Save.
trans-unit.target: Select the Developers check box, and then click Save.

trans-unit.source: In this step of the tutorial, we will add the Echo API to the new Free Trial product.
trans-unit.target: In this step of the tutorial, we will add the Echo API to the new Free Trial product.

trans-unit.source: Each API Management service instance comes pre-configured with an Echo API that can be used to experiment with and learn about API Management.
trans-unit.target: Each API Management service instance comes pre-configured with an Echo API that can be used to experiment with and learn about API Management.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Get started with Azure API Management</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Get started with Azure API Management</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Click Products from the API Management menu on the left, and then click Free Trial to configure the product.
trans-unit.target: Click Products from the API Management menu on the left, and then click Free Trial to configure the product.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure product</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure product</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add API to product.
trans-unit.target: Click Add API to product.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add API to product</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add API to product</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select Echo API, and then click Save.
trans-unit.target: Select Echo API, and then click Save.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add Echo API</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add Echo API</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Rate limits and quotas are configured in the policy editor.
trans-unit.target: Rate limits and quotas are configured in the policy editor.

trans-unit.source: Click Policies under the API Management menu on the left.
trans-unit.target: Click Policies under the API Management menu on the left.

trans-unit.source: In the Product list, click Free Trial.
trans-unit.target: In the Product list, click Free Trial.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Product policy</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Product policy</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add Policy to import the policy template and begin creating the rate limit and quota policies.
trans-unit.target: Click Add Policy to import the policy template and begin creating the rate limit and quota policies.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add policy</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add policy</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To insert policies, position the cursor into either the inbound or outbound section of the policy template.
trans-unit.target: To insert policies, position the cursor into either the inbound or outbound section of the policy template.

trans-unit.source: Rate limit and quota policies are inbound policies, so position the cursor in the inbound element.
trans-unit.target: Rate limit and quota policies are inbound policies, so position the cursor in the inbound element.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Policy editor</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Policy editor</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The two policies we are adding in this tutorial are the <linkText>Limit call rate</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Set usage quota</linkText><title></title> policies.
trans-unit.target: The two policies we are adding in this tutorial are the <linkText>Limit call rate</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Set usage quota</linkText><title></title> policies.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Policy statements</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Policy statements</linkText>

trans-unit.source: After the cursor is positioned in the inbound policy element, click the arrow beside Limit call rate to insert its policy template.
trans-unit.target: After the cursor is positioned in the inbound policy element, click the arrow beside Limit call rate to insert its policy template.

trans-unit.source: Limit call rate can be used at the product level and can also be used at the API and individual operation name levels.
trans-unit.target: Limit call rate can be used at the product level and can also be used at the API and individual operation name levels.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, only product-level policies are used, so delete the api and operation elements from the rate-limit element, so only the outer rate-limit element remains, as shown in the following example.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, only product-level policies are used, so delete the api and operation elements from the rate-limit element, so only the outer rate-limit element remains, as shown in the following example.

trans-unit.source: In the Free Trial product, the maximum allowable call rate is 10 calls per minute, so type 10 as the value for the calls attribute, and 60 for the renewal-period attribute.
trans-unit.target: In the Free Trial product, the maximum allowable call rate is 10 calls per minute, so type 10 as the value for the calls attribute, and 60 for the renewal-period attribute.

trans-unit.source: To configure the Set usage quota policy, position your cursor immediately below the newly added rate-limit element within the inbound element, and then click the arrow to the left of Set usage quota.
trans-unit.target: To configure the Set usage quota policy, position your cursor immediately below the newly added rate-limit element within the inbound element, and then click the arrow to the left of Set usage quota.

trans-unit.source: Because this policy is also intended to be at the product level, delete the api and operation name elements, as shown in the following example.
trans-unit.target: Because this policy is also intended to be at the product level, delete the api and operation name elements, as shown in the following example.

trans-unit.source: Quotas can be based on the number of calls per interval, bandwidth, or both.
trans-unit.target: Quotas can be based on the number of calls per interval, bandwidth, or both.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, we are not throttling based on bandwidth, so delete the bandwidth attribute.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, we are not throttling based on bandwidth, so delete the bandwidth attribute.

trans-unit.source: In the Free Trial product, the quota is 200 calls per week.
trans-unit.target: In the Free Trial product, the quota is 200 calls per week.

trans-unit.source: Specify 200 as the value for the calls attribute, and then specify 604800 as the value for the renewal-period attribute.
trans-unit.target: Specify 200 as the value for the calls attribute, and then specify 604800 as the value for the renewal-period attribute.

trans-unit.source: Policy intervals are specified in seconds.
trans-unit.target: Policy intervals are specified in seconds.

trans-unit.source: To calculate the interval for a week, you can multiply the number of days (7) by the number of hours in a day (24) by the number of minutes in an hour (60) by the number of seconds in a minute (60): 7 * 24 * 60 * 60 = 604800.
trans-unit.target: To calculate the interval for a week, you can multiply the number of days (7) by the number of hours in a day (24) by the number of minutes in an hour (60) by the number of seconds in a minute (60): 7 * 24 * 60 * 60 = 604800.

trans-unit.source: When you have finished configuring the policy, it should match the following example.
trans-unit.target: When you have finished configuring the policy, it should match the following example.

trans-unit.source: After the desired policies are configured, click Save.
trans-unit.target: After the desired policies are configured, click Save.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Save policy</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Save policy</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Now that the the APIs are added and the policies are configured, the product must be published so that it can be used by developers.
trans-unit.target: Now that the the APIs are added and the policies are configured, the product must be published so that it can be used by developers.

trans-unit.source: Click Products from the API Management menu on the left, and then click Free Trial to configure the product.
trans-unit.target: Click Products from the API Management menu on the left, and then click Free Trial to configure the product.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure product</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure product</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Publish, and then click Yes, publish it to confirm.
trans-unit.target: Click Publish, and then click Yes, publish it to confirm.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Publish product</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Publish product</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Now that the product is published, it is available to be subscribed to and used by developers.
trans-unit.target: Now that the product is published, it is available to be subscribed to and used by developers.

trans-unit.source: Administrators of an API Management instance are automatically subscribed to every product.
trans-unit.target: Administrators of an API Management instance are automatically subscribed to every product.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial step, we will subscribe one of the non-administrator developer accounts to the Free Trial product.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial step, we will subscribe one of the non-administrator developer accounts to the Free Trial product.

trans-unit.source: If your developer account is part of the Administrators role, then you can follow along with this step, even though you are already subscribed.
trans-unit.target: If your developer account is part of the Administrators role, then you can follow along with this step, even though you are already subscribed.

trans-unit.source: Click Users on the API Management menu on the left, and then click the name of your developer account.
trans-unit.target: Click Users on the API Management menu on the left, and then click the name of your developer account.

trans-unit.source: In this example, we are using the Clayton Gragg developer account.
trans-unit.target: In this example, we are using the Clayton Gragg developer account.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure developer</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure developer</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add Subscription.
trans-unit.target: Click Add Subscription.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add subscription</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add subscription</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select Free Trial, and then click Subscribe.
trans-unit.target: Select Free Trial, and then click Subscribe.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add subscription</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add subscription</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, multiple simultaneous subscriptions are not enabled for the Free Trial product.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, multiple simultaneous subscriptions are not enabled for the Free Trial product.

trans-unit.source: If they were, you would be prompted to name the subscription, as shown in the following example.
trans-unit.target: If they were, you would be prompted to name the subscription, as shown in the following example.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add subscription</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add subscription</linkText>

trans-unit.source: After clicking Subscribe, the product appears in the Subscription list for the user.
trans-unit.target: After clicking Subscribe, the product appears in the Subscription list for the user.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Subscription added</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Subscription added</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Now that the Free Trial product is configured and published, we can call some operations and test the rate limit policy.
trans-unit.target: Now that the Free Trial product is configured and published, we can call some operations and test the rate limit policy.

trans-unit.source: Switch to the developer portal by clicking Developer portal in the upper-right menu.
trans-unit.target: Switch to the developer portal by clicking Developer portal in the upper-right menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Developer portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Developer portal</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click APIs in the top menu, and then click Echo API.
trans-unit.target: Click APIs in the top menu, and then click Echo API.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Developer portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Developer portal</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click GET Resource, and then click Open Console.
trans-unit.target: Click GET Resource, and then click Open Console.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Open console</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Open console</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Keep the default parameter values, and then select your subscription key for the Free Trial product.
trans-unit.target: Keep the default parameter values, and then select your subscription key for the Free Trial product.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Subscription key</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Subscription key</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you have multiple subscriptions, be sure to select the key for Free Trial, or else the policies that were configured in the previous steps won't be in effect.
trans-unit.target: If you have multiple subscriptions, be sure to select the key for Free Trial, or else the policies that were configured in the previous steps won't be in effect.

trans-unit.source: Click HTTP Get, and then view the response.
trans-unit.target: Click HTTP Get, and then view the response.

trans-unit.source: Note the Response status of 200 OK.
trans-unit.target: Note the Response status of 200 OK.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Operation results</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Operation results</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click HTTP Get at a rate greater than the rate limit policy of 10 calls per minute.
trans-unit.target: Click HTTP Get at a rate greater than the rate limit policy of 10 calls per minute.

trans-unit.source: After the rate limit policy is exceeded, a response status of 429 Too Many Requests is returned.
trans-unit.target: After the rate limit policy is exceeded, a response status of 429 Too Many Requests is returned.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Operation results</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Operation results</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The Response Headers and Response content areas indicate the remaining interval before retries will be successful.
trans-unit.target: The Response Headers and Response content areas indicate the remaining interval before retries will be successful.

trans-unit.source: When the rate limit policy of 10 calls per minute is in effect, subsequent calls will fail until 60 seconds have elapsed from the first of the 10 successful calls to the product before the rate limit was exceeded.
trans-unit.target: When the rate limit policy of 10 calls per minute is in effect, subsequent calls will fail until 60 seconds have elapsed from the first of the 10 successful calls to the product before the rate limit was exceeded.

trans-unit.source: In this example, the remaining interval is 43 seconds.
trans-unit.target: In this example, the remaining interval is 43 seconds.

trans-unit.source: Check out the other topics in the <linkText>Get started with advanced API configuration</linkText><title></title> tutorial.
trans-unit.target: Check out the other topics in the <linkText>Get started with advanced API configuration</linkText><title></title> tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Watch a demo of setting rate limits and quotas in the following video.
trans-unit.target: Watch a demo of setting rate limits and quotas in the following video.
